/ˈstɔntʃ·li, ˈstɑntʃ-/
She staunchly supports the party’s candidates.
staunch verb [T]
(STOP)
to stop liquid, esp. blood, from flowing out: Mike pressed hard on the wound and staunched the flow of blood.
To staunch is also to keep something from continuing: The company abandoned the plan to staunch the departure of more managers.
